headline.main: Court Says Privacy Case Can Proceed vs. Google
headline.print_headline: Court Says Privacy Case Can Proceed Vs. Google

docs.abstract: Federal appeals court in San Francisco says lawsuit accusing Google of illegal wiretapping can proceed, in major legal setback for Internet giant; ruling, which comes at moment when online privacy is being hotly debated, has its origins in Google's Street View; unanimous decision finds little merit in firm's legal maneuverings, stating at one critical point that the company was basically inventing meanings in an effort to declare its actions legal.
